intro: Kohautia microcala, commonly known as the small-flowered kohautia, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in dense spikes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
